IRS Code 560 Meaning

IRS Code 560 generally indicates additional liability is pending. It reflects a freeze or hold while the IRS considers assessing more tax or adjusting the module. Understanding what triggered it is key before advising clients.

Try the parser (requires credits)

What is IRS Code 560?

Plain-English definition: Code 560 signals that additional tax liability is pending review or assessment. It commonly appears before a formal assessment entry posts.

Common transcript type
Account Transcript
Often appears near
Codes 290, 570
Typical context
Potential assessment adjustment
Client-friendly summary
"The IRS may be adding more tax"

When does Code 560 appear?

  • Before an assessment posts: Often precedes Code 290.
  • During review or examination: May relate to pending adjustments.
  • When liability changes are being evaluated: Signals the module is under review.

What should you verify?

  1. Look for a subsequent Code 290 assessment.
  2. Check for Code 570 indicating additional freeze activity.
  3. Review Code 971 for notice issuance explaining the change.

Example in a parsed report

Assessment sequence
Code 560 – Additional liability pending
Code 290 – Additional tax assessed

FAQ

What does IRS Code 560 mean?

It indicates potential additional tax liability is pending review.

Is Code 560 serious?

It requires attention, as it may precede additional tax assessment.

Does 560 mean I owe more tax?

Not necessarily yet, but it often precedes a formal assessment.

What other codes matter?

Review 290, 570, and 971 for full context.
